meanings.definition: voluntary self-punishment inflicted as an outward expression of repentance for having done wrong
meanings.sent1: After breaking the vase, as a penance, she cleaned the entire house.
meanings.sent2: He performed a penance by fasting for a day to show his regret.
meanings.sent3: As a penance, he had to wear a silly hat all day.
meanings.sent4: Her penance of writing lines on the chalkboard seemed endless.
meanings.sent5: The penance of running laps around the field made him think twice before misbehaving again.

meanings.definition: an act of self-mortification or devotion performed to show sorrow or repentance for sin
meanings.sent1: As a penance, she gave up sweets for a week.
meanings.sent2: The monk's daily penance included long hours of prayer.
meanings.sent3: His penance of doing extra chores made his siblings laugh.
meanings.sent4: The penance of kneeling on rice grains was a painful reminder of his mistake.
meanings.sent5: The penance of climbing the steep hill symbolized his journey to redemption.
